context: The Finnish verb 'uida' means 'to swim'. It is an intransitive and transitive verb, indicating movement through water without touching the bottom. The dictionary definitions show a full conjugation of the verb in different tenses and moods, including present, past, conditional, imperative, and potential.  It can also mean to bathe in natural bodies of water. The word 'uida' does not appear to have any obvious components or related words within itself.
